extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large red onion, cut into wedges

extendedIngredients.name: skinless chicken thigh
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 skinless chicken thigh fillets, each cut into large chunks

extendedIngredients.name: sweet potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 500g sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into bite-size pieces

recipes.title: Sweet potato & chicken curry

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken can be paired with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 27 dollars.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Cook the sweet potatoes in boiling,salted water for 5-7 mins until just tender.Drain well, then set aside. Meanwhile,heat the oil in a large frying pan, then addthe chicken and onion. Cook for 5-6 minsuntil the chicken is browned and cookedthrough. Stir in the curry paste, cook for1 min, add the tomatoes, then cook foranother min.Pour in 100ml boiling water and mixwell. Simmer for 5 mins, add the spinach,then cook for 2 mins until wilted. Fold inthe potatoes and heat through. Servewith rice and naan breads.

steps.step: Cook the sweet potatoes in boiling,salted water for 5-7 mins until just tender.

Drain well, then set aside. Meanwhile,heat the oil in a large frying pan, then addthe chicken and onion. Cook for 5-6 minsuntil the chicken is browned and cookedthrough. Stir in the curry paste, cook for1 min, add the tomatoes, then cook foranother min.
Pour in 100ml boiling water and mixwell. Simmer for 5 mins, add the spinach,then cook for 2 mins until wilted. Fold inthe potatoes and heat through.
